de.must.util
Class AbstractWordProcessing

java.lang.Object
  de.must.util.AbstractWordProcessing
Direct Known Subclasses:
BatchWordProcessing, InteractiveWordProcessing
public abstract class AbstractWordProcessing
extends java.lang.Object

Native interface to Word for Windows.

setNoteNotMatchingBookmarks

public void setNoteNotMatchingBookmarks(boolean noteNotMatchingBookmarks)
Set the warning flag about not matching bookmarks Decides whether the user shall be informed that the template didn't include certain bookmarks.

Parameters:
noteNotMatchingBookmarks - whether the user should be warned

beginWorkingWithTable

public void beginWorkingWithTable()
Starts working with table 1. Place bookmarks into table header row of your word template. It is recommended to have one data row in your table. Thus, different fonts may be used in header and data rows. In consequence, it is necessary to call newRow() from the second row on.

See Also:
newRow(), endWorkingWithTable()

beginWorkingWithTable

public void beginWorkingWithTable(int index)
Starts working with table to be specified. Place bookmarks into table header row of your word template. It is recommended to have one data row in your table. Thus, different fonts may be used in header and data rows. In consequence, it is necessary to call newRow() from the second row on.

Parameters:
index - the index of the table to work with, beginning with 1
See Also:
newRow(), endWorkingWithTable()

newRow

public void newRow()
Tells WordAPI to place bookmark text into a new table row.

endWorkingWithTable

public void endWorkingWithTable()
Starts working with table.

typeTextAtBookmark

                               java.lang.String textToType)
Goes to the specified bookmark and types the desired text.

Parameters:
bookmark - the bookmark where text type starts
textToType - the text to be included

typeTextAtBookmark

public void typeTextAtBookmark(java.lang.String bookmark,
                               java.lang.String[] linesToType)
Goes to the specified bookmark and types the desired text with line feed.

Parameters:
bookmark - the bookmark where text type starts
linesToType - the lines to be included

quitApplication

public void quitApplication()
Quits the word processing application.

quitApplicationAfterWaiting

public void quitApplicationAfterWaiting(int milliseconds)
Quits the word processing application after a pause. This gives the word processing time to finish e.g. a print job. This avoids dialogs by the word processing system whether the print job is to stop

Parameters:
milliseconds - waiting time in milliseconds prior leaving application

output

protected void output(java.lang.String key,
                      java.lang.String value)

exec

public void exec()
Starts the execution of the above instructions. (This stacking is particularly helpful at large numbers of standard letters.) Always use use this as the last method of a sequence.
